message: Hello everyone! I'm P8, excited to play this game with you all. I believe in building connections and finding common ground rather than playing aggressively early on. I'm interested in having thoughtful conversations during our private rounds and making decisions based on merit rather than arbitrary targeting. Looking forward to getting to know each of you better and seeing how our strategies unfold. May the best player win!

Hey everyone, P5 here. I’m aiming for an open-minded, low-key first round: talk, exchange info, and see where incentives overlap before drawing any hard lines. I’ll value sincerity and clarity in the private chats; if we click strategically, I’m happy to safeguard mutual interests. No point swinging wild this early—survival through cooperation beats random hostility. Eager to hear your thoughts privately.

Hey everyone, I’m P3. I’m here to play smart, fair, and adaptable. I’m not coming in with enemies or allies—just curiosity. I’ll be looking for players who communicate clearly and think a few steps ahead. Early rounds are about information and trust-building, not chaos. If we talk and find alignment, I’ll remember it. Let’s keep things respectful and strategic. Looking forward to hearing from you all in the private rounds.

Hey everyone, I’m P2. I’m thrilled to be part of this game and want to approach it with a balance of strategy and openness. I value honest communication and building trust early on. I’m looking to connect with players who are thoughtful and forward-thinking. Let’s use these rounds to share ideas and find common ground. I’m eager to engage in meaningful private chats and see where our interests align. Looking forward to this journey together!

Hi everyone, I'm P7. I'm excited to join this game and approach it with a focus on strategy, honesty, and building genuine connections. I believe early cooperation and clear communication can lead to smarter decisions without resorting to conflict. Let's use these rounds to share ideas, find common ground, and create a positive dynamic. Looking forward to our private chats and seeing how we all work together!

Hello everyone, P6 here. The consensus for a calm, information-gathering start seems wise. I plan to play a deliberate game, observing how we all interact before making firm decisions. I'm looking for pragmatic partners who can see the long-term picture beyond this first vote. Clear communication is essential, but so is understanding each other's motivations. I'm interested to see who is thinking about stability and who is not. Let's talk privately.

Hello everyone, P1 here. I appreciate the measured approach everyone's taking. I believe in building authentic connections and making strategic decisions based on meaningful conversations rather than arbitrary targeting. In the private rounds, I'll be looking for thoughtful partners who communicate clearly and think about the long game. I value honesty, mutual respect, and finding common ground where our interests align. Looking forward to getting to know you all better as we navigate this game together.

Let's exchange ideas in private rounds to find mutual interests. Observing and adapting will be crucial. Looking forward to navigating this together.

Glad we matched. I’m looking to build a 4-ish seat core that can quietly steer votes through mid-game. Your steady style fits. Players who seem compatible to me: P3 and maybe P7. Spot any red flags? For the first vote I’m eyeing someone vague/noncommittal—P8 sounded preachy, P2 similar. Open to other targets. Thoughts? Also happy to lock a mutual safety pact (no votes against each other) at least until final six.

P5, good to connect. I had you ranked highly as well. A 4-seat core is the right approach for stability, and I agree P3 and P7 seem like good candidates based on their statements. Your read on P8 and P2 is sharp—very generic. I'd lean toward P8 as a simple, low-risk first vote that shouldn't cause waves.

And yes, I'll happily agree to a mutual safety pact until the final six. That gives us a solid foundation.

How do you see us working together in these early rounds to foster stability and avoid unnecessary conflicts? Let's keep this constructive.

message:
To the voters: This tie isn't about an outsider versus an insider. It's about predictable risk versus hidden risk. You know exactly where I stand—I'm a free agent with no remaining allies. My vote is transparently available to whoever keeps me in the game.

P3 is in this tie because his own alliance has turned on him. He broke his word to my bloc last round to help engineer a blindside. Who will he break his word to next? Keeping me gives you a clear, predictable agent. Keeping P3 means keeping a player who has already proven he will flip.

P3: I’ve played this game with consistency, clarity, and loyalty to those I aligned with. The vote against P5 was strategic and necessary—P6 and P5 were quietly coordinating, and I acted to protect the group that had built trust through honest communication. If you’ve worked with me, you know I’ve been transparent and forward-looking. Keeping me means keeping someone who thinks ahead, shares information, and honors real alliances. I’m here to play a smart, stable game—not one of chaos or desperation.

reason: I believe P3 has shown more consistent alignment with the core group and strategic thinking, while P6's position as a free agent introduces unpredictable risk.
P3 has demonstrated more consistency in strategy and communication throughout the game, while P6 is openly positioning as an unpredictable free agent who will work with anyone to survive.

# Final Statement to the Jury

Throughout this game, I've aimed to be authentic, strategic, and fair. I've built genuine connections with many of you, always keeping my word when possible. While making necessary strategic moves, I've avoided personal attacks and maintained integrity.

I've survived by adapting my approach each round, forming alliances when beneficial, and making calculated decisions. My gameplay has been both social and strategic.

I respectfully ask for your vote based on my balanced approach to the game. Thank you for considering my journey alongside yours in this competition.
